text: Life.  Glorious in its many forms.  The biological pulse finding its way heroically through the cold manipulation science. CREDITS as we see a beautiful montage of futuristic medic technology.  Through a microscope we see cells multiplyin and gene strands exponentially increasing with the vibran of exploding flowers.  We see laser splicing and biologic manipulation on the molecular level. CREDITS continue as we fade to...

Politics... In a cavernous, shadowy chamber.  Dark figure lean together and talk seriously.  Their hushed, urgent t denote the gravity of their discussion. We can't make out the words but there is no doubt what th are talking about. The three year old HUMAN BOY who stands before them.  The is alone and frightened, lost in the sweeping grandeur of the massive chamber. CREDITS continue as we fade to...

Labor... On a stark, desert planet with monolithic mountains and h crags shooting upward.  The only light in this dark netherworld comes from the flames that accompany the hell mining operations everywhere around us. The human boy gazes over this desolate vista and then he looks up for a moment... at the stars. Then a tall figure leads him firmly into one of the mines The boy seems to disappear into this flaming crucible. CREDITS end as we go to...

The sun is setting on the capital city of the great Romul Star Empire, The imperial monoliths and martial towers of this bustling city glow red as the sun dips below the horizon. We slowly move down toward the most imposing building of city.  The Romulan Senate chamber.

SENATOR TAL'AURA watches the proceedings with a studied l of bored indifference.  She glances to the familiar Romul crest that dominates one wall of the chamber: a ferocious bird-of-prey holding two planets, one in either claw. And then her eyes carefully cross the chamber to... PRAETOR HIREN -- the head of the Romulan government -- presiding over the Senate from a throne-like chair.  He i capable politician in his 50s.
... but if we hesitate we'll lose this important source of dilithium. A trade agreement is in the best interests of the Empire.
Praetor, I recommend we dispatch a diplomatic mission to Celes II to open negotiations. Senator Tal'Aura grunts slightly at the word "negotiation Praetor Hiren glances to her.
Senator Tal'Aura, you disagree with the motion.

No, sir.  I would say "negotiation" is to be advised.  I support all "diplomatic" overtures.  But if you will excuse me, Praetor, I have an appointment with the Tholian ambassador. The Praetor nods.  Tal'Aura stands and leaves the chamber but she had left something behind on her desk.  A small, silver box with unusual etchings on the surface. The discussion continues as we focus on the silver box...

Then I will call for a vote on the motion to open trade negotiations with Celes II... The Senator at the desk next to Tal'Aura's glances over. silver box is moving. The Senator watches, amazed, as the box begins to slowly open.  Then "legs" appear.  The box unfolds like a spider standing on its legs.  Then it is still for a moment.  Th Senator looks at it, puzzled. Suddenly -- a bright beam of green light shoots up from t spider -- the Senators are stunned -- the beam shoots to high domed ceiling of the chamber and then cascades aroun the interior of the room, enveloping everything in a glow shroud of green energy.  In a way, it is bizarrely beauti And then just as suddenly the light disappears. A moment of silence.  The Praetor and Senators are baffle
Would someone please tell me what that was? (he turns to a guard) Alert security -- A plant behind the Praetor begins to shrivel...

-- and have them run a -- The Praetor stops suddenly -- as the flesh begins to melt from his face. Every bit of organic matter in the chamber decays.  Flesh melts from bones while the Senators scream in agony.  Eve living thing in the chamber is dead within ten seconds. A stunning moment of silence as we take in the carnage. a transporter effect ripples around the spider-weapon.  I disappears. And the Romulan Senate is no more.  We fade to...

JEAN LUC PICARD, the most beloved and respected Captain i Starfleet. His face is resolute and set.  Even stern.  His white dre uniform is buttoned tightly to the neck. He looks at us evenly and then utters the word that has b the watch cry for his entire life as a Starfleet officer.
Duty... He lets the word resonate and then continues.

A starship captain's life is filled with solemn duty.  I have commanded men in battle.  I have negotiated peace treaties between implacable enemies.  I have represented the Federation in first contact with twenty-seven alien species.  But none of this compares to my solemn duty as... Best man. Uproarious laughter.  We pull back to reveal the wedding reception of WILL RIKER and DEANNA TROI. The Enterprise CREW is gathered with invited GUESTS, some from other "Star Trek" series.  Riker and Deanna sit at t center of a long table.

Now, I know that on an occasion such as this: it is expected that I be gracious and fulsome with praise on the wonders of this blessed union... But have you two considered what you're doing to? This is all a damned inconvenience... (laughter from the crowd) While you're happily settling in on the Titan, I'll have to train a new first officer; no doubt a stern martinet who'll quote the rule book at me and never... ever... allow me to go on away missions. (laughter) ... Then there's the matter of my new counselor.  Undoubtedly some soft-spoken, willowy thing who'll be probing into my darkest psyche as she nods her head and coos sympathetically.  Isn't that right, Deanna? Deanna nods her head and coos sympathetically.  Hearty, wonderful LAUGHTER!

I notice Dr. Crusher laughing along with the rest of you.  As most of you know, the doctor will also soon be leaving the Enterprise, to assume command of Starfleet Medical.  Again, I'm forced to ask, Beverly, have you considered what you're doing to little ole' me?! I'll probably get some old battle- axe of a doctor who'll tell me to eat my vegetables and put me on report if I don't show up for my physical on time!
It'll serve you right. Laughter, laughter, laughter!  He looks to Riker and Dean
Really, it's not too late to reconsider.  No?  Very well then... He smiles and raises his glass, looks at them deeply.

Will Riker, you have been my trusted right arm for fourteen years; you have helped keep my course true and steady.  Deanna Troi, you have been my conscience and best guide, the touchstone to the better parts of myself.  You are my family.  And in proper maritime tradition I wish you full sails and a clear horizon... My friends, make it so. They drink.

The party guests mingle as a band plays.  We are at a beautiful open-air pavilion high in the Denali Mountains. The soaring ranges of Riker's native Alaska can be seen everywhere around us. DR. BEVERLY CRUSHER goes to Picard.
(playfully) Sort of like losing a son and gaining an empath, isn't it?
Please, Beverly, this is hard enough.

If you start tearing up I promise to beam you out.  Level one medical emergency.  There's no crying in Starfleet. They head off toward Riker and Deanna. Meanwhile, GEORDI LA FORGE sits with his girlfriend.
I've never seen your Captain so nostalgic.  Maybe he's getting soft in his old age.
(laughs) Not likely.  After we installed the new Series Four replicators, he tried to order his usual tea and there was a glitch.  Had us remove the whole bunch of them and put the old ones back in.
There!  Nostalgic about old replicators.

He just likes things the way he likes them... (he looks at her, smiles) Of course, so do I. He kisses her gently as WORF comes to them.  Poor Worf is still suffering a bit from the bachelor party.  He plops beside them, belches.
Romulan ale should be illegal.
It is, old chum.
Then it should be more illegal. He groans and rests his head on the table, acts like he's going to heave.  Meanwhile, Riker and Deanna are talking Picard and Beverly.
Really, Captain, it was a lovely toast.
The least I could do for you, Deanna.  Besides, you know me... I'm a talking head.
And you needn't worry.  I'll brief your new counselor on everything she needs to know.
The hell you will.  You know too much about me as it is... Now you promised there are no speeches during the ceremony on Betazed.
No, no speeches.  No clothes either. (winks, mischievously) Picard looks at him.  Deanna laughs. Then the band stops playing.  All turn. DATA stands with the band.

Ladies and Gentlemen and invited Tran gendered species... In my study of Terran and Betazoid conjugal rites I have discovered it is traditional to present the "happy couple" with a gift.  Given Commander Riker's affection for archaic musical forms I have elected to present the following as my gift in honor of their conjugation. Riker shoots an amused glance to Deanna.  Conjugation? Data turns to the band leader.
If you please, Mister Band Leader, a-one and a-two and... The band launches into a jaunty, swing version of the Irv Berlin standard "Blue Skies."

(sings) "Blue skies, smiling at me, Nothing but blue skies do I see.  Blue birds, singing a song, Nothing but blue birds all day long.  Never saw the sun shining so bright, Never saw things going so right..." The crowd is appreciative.  Loves the song.  Except Worf, momentarily raises his head from the table.
(groans) Ugghhh... Irving Berlin. His heads thumps down again, is about ready to BARF! Meanwhile, Riker is anxious as a kid to join the band:
(smiles) All right, go ahead. Riker eagerly joins the band.  Grabs the trombone and sta jamming with the orchestra.  The song really swings.
(to Deanna) May I have this dance?
With pleasure, Captain. Meanwhile, Geordi leads Leah to the dance floor as well. Beverly goes to Worf.
Commander Worf... Do Klingons swing?
I am not a swinger.  I am unwell.
Don't worry, I'm a doctor. She pulls him to the dance floor as:
I'm so glad you made it back to the Enterprise before I left.
I was not suited for the life of a... diplomat.

(wry) Who'd have guessed? They dance.  Picard and Deanna sweep past them. And we pull up and away as Data continues to sing and the crew dances.  It is a joyous celebration of these people. This family.  A family we love.
The Enterprise streaks through space.

Data sits in the empty Crew Lounge. As always, the android's placid, neutral expression still somehow manages to convey his wonder, curiosity and idiosyncratic zest for life. Picard arrives with a very old bottle of wine.
I've been saving this.  Chateau Picard 2267.  Batten down the hatches... He carefully uncorks the treasured bottle as:
They say a vintner's history is in every glass.  The soil he came from.  His past as well as his hopes for the future. He pours two glasses of the wine, then raises his glass, toast.
So... To happy endings.
To happy endings. Picard carefully takes a tiny sip, savors the flavor, fin swallows.  Enjoys it.  Ahhh. Data mimics Picard.  Taking a tiny sip, savoring the flav and finally swallowing.  Ahhh.

Sir.  I noticed an interesting confluence of emotion at the wedding.  I am familiar with the human concept of tears through laughter and its inverse, laughter through tears, but I could not help wondering about the human capacity for expressing both pleasure and sadness simultaneously.

I understand why it would seem confusing.  Certain human rituals -- like weddings, birthdays or funerals evoke strong and very complex emotions.  These rites carry great weight with us because they denote the passage of time.
And you were particularly aware of this feeling because Commander Riker will be leaving to assume command of the Titan?
Will and Deanna joining the Titan. Dr. Crusher going to Starfleet Medical...
And this makes you "sad"?
Well.  I suppose it does a bit. I'm very happy for them, of course, but I'm going to miss them.  The ship will seem... incomplete without them.
That is because you have a familiarity with them.  You can predict specific reactions and behavior and are comfortable in that knowledge.
Yes.  And, frankly, I envy them as well.  They've made important choices; they're going to have great challenges ahead of them. New worlds to conquer... He takes another sip of wine.  A beat.

Seeing Will and Deanna today made me think about some of the choices I've made in my own life.  Devoting myself to Starfleet... Not marrying or having children... All the choices that led me here. A beat.  Data thinks about it.
The choices I made have led me here as well.  This is the only home I have ever known.  I cannot foresee a reason for leaving.
You never know what's over the horizon, Data.  Before too long you'll be offered a command of your own.  Data looks at him; he has never really considered this.
If I were... I believe my memory engrams would sense the absence of your specific reactions and behavior.  I would "miss you."
(smiles) Now, you make a toast.
To new worlds...
New worlds.  Yes Data, brave new worlds... They drink.

Flickering braziers dimly illuminate the cold, martial splendor of a Senate corridor. COMMANDER DONATRA and COMMANDER SURAN stride through the corridor. Suran is an elder Romulan officer, respected and tenaciou Donatra -- a key figure in this story so pay close attent to her -- is a mature, beautiful woman... not without a d sense of humor.
The fleet commanders are nervous. They've agreed to remain at their given coordinates and await his orders.  But they're anxious to know what's going on here.
I don't blame them.  We can't keep them in the dark forever. A voice, from the shadows:

But in darkness, there is strength. Donatra and Suran stop. And the VICEROY steps from the shadows... He is a terrifying sight  A powerful, monstrous alien creature; a tall, ashen-skinned ectomorph who bears a disturbing resemblance to the original Nosferatu.  He is vampiric and lethal.  He is a Reman.
Don't you agree? He leads them along the corridor.
We observe the Romulan crest, an imposing bird-of-prey clutching a planet in either claw, not unlike the KAOS em from "Get Smart," that dominates a wall.  As we hear:

Consider it  The great symbol of the Empire... But the bird-of-prey holds planets.  Romulus, Remus. Their destinies conjoined... And then we see him... SHINZON! He is a dynamic young human in his twenties.  Very handso with pale, almost white skin and shining, golden hair.  H wears a striking Reman military uniform. He stands in the center of the eerily deserted chamber. entire floor is a large star chart.

Yet for generations one of those planets has been without a voice. We will be silent no longer. Senator Tal'Aura (the female Senator who planted the weap in the Senate chamber earlier) and two other ROMULAN COMMANDERS sit. Cadres of Shinzon's fearsome REMAN WARRIORS stand around chamber.  They are his sinister children of the night.  E more chilling now in the flickering torch light.  It's li something out of Tim Burton. Donatra and Suran enter the chamber with Shinzon's Vicero
Join us, Commanders.  Now what's the disposition of the fleet?
They're holding position.
And?
(bows his head) They will obey, Praetor.
It's imperative we retain their allegiance or our great mission will be strangled before it can truly draw breath.
They support your intentions, sir. But they require evidence of your... sincerity. Shinzon looks at her.  A quick beat.  Shinzon decides to respond with benevolence.  He smiles.

And they'll have it. (he begins to pace over the star chart) Tell the fleet that the days of negotiation and diplomacy are over. The Almighty Federation will fall before us.  As I promised you. He stands on the area of the map that denotes the Neutral Zone between the Romulan Empire and the Federation.
The time we have dreamed of is at hand.  The time... of conquest. (sinister laugh) He carefully steps into the area of the map marked with t Federation symbol.  He looks down at the star chart.
Cut off the dragon's head and it cannot strike back. A beat.  Donatra watches him carefully.  Something in his quiet words disturbs her.
How many Warbirds will you need?
None. They look at him, stunned.
Praetor.  You have the whole fleet at your disposal.  They supported the coup, they'll follow you.
The Scimitar will serve my needs.
But surely --

I came this far alone... (he looks at his Reman warriors) We came this far alone.  We require no assistance from the fleet.  Now leave me to my thoughts. The Commanders and Senator Tal'Aura rise and leave.  Shin looks to his Viceroy.
Are we prepared?
Yes, Praetor. A beat.
So many years for this moment. (he looks up at his Viceroy, smiles) Bring him to me.
The bridge crew are at their stations.  Picard is not on bridge.
(grumbles) I won't do it.
It's tradition,Worf.  You of all people should appreciate that! (whispers) Besides, I've already seen it.
A warrior does not appear without his clothing.  It leaves him... vulnerable.
I don't think we're going to see much combat on Betazed.
Don't be too sure.  Mother will be there. Worf groans.  Picard emerges from his Ready Room as:
I won't do it.
Won't do what, Mister Worf?
Captain.  I think it is inappropriate for a Starfleet officer to appear... (hates the word) ... naked.
Come now, a big, strapping fellow like you?  What are you afraid of? Deanna laughs.  Then a readout on Worf's console attracts attention:
I'm picking up an unusual electromagnetic signature from the Kolarin system.
What sort of signature? Worf looks up.  Glances at Data.
Positronic.
Geordi is at the Engineering station with Picard, Riker a Data.
It's very faint but I've isolated it to the third planet in the Kolarin system.
What do we know about the planet?
Uncharted.  We'll have to get closer for a more detailed scan.
(to Data) Theories?
Since positronic signatures have only been known to emanate from androids such as myself, it is logical to theorize that there is an android such as myself on Kolarus III.
How many of you did Dr. Soong make?
I thought only me, myself and Lore.
(looking at star chart) Diverting to the Kolarin system takes us awfully close to the Romulan Neutral Zone.
(looking at star chart) Still well on our side... Picard glances at Data, recognizes the android's deep des to explore this possible connection to others like himsel
I think it's worth a look.  Don't worry, Number One, we'll get you to Betazed with time to spare.
Thank you, sir...
(to all, especially Worf) Where we will all honor the Betazoid traditions.  No cold feet, or any other parts of our anatomy. Now, if you'll excuse me.  I'll be in the gym. He goes.
(to Helm Officer) Mister Branson, set course for the Kolarin system.  Warp Five -- (Deanna shoots him a glance) -- Warp Seven.
Plotted and laid in, sir.
Engage.
You better believe you're engaged! Meanwhile, Geordi and Data remain at the Engineering Stat studying the displays.
What do you think, Data, a long- lost relative? Data doesn't respond, but the curiosity on his face is apparent.
The Enterprise is in orbit around the uncharted planet. the distance we can see the distorting violence of an ion storm.
Kolarus III is on the viewscreen, the ion storm raging be it.
I read six distinct positronic signatures, spread out over a few kilometers on the surface.
What do we know about the population?
Isolated pockets of humanoids.  It appears to be a pre-warp civilization at an early stage of industrial development.
Captain, I don't recommend transporting, that ion storm doesn't look very neighborly.  It could head this way without much warning.
Understood.  Data, Worf, you're with me. Picard, Data and Worf start heading toward the turbolift.
(stands, protesting) Captain, I hope I don't have to remind you --
I appreciate your concern, Number One, but I've been itching to try out the Argo.
Sir --
Captain's prerogative, Will. There's no foreseeable danger... and your wife would never forgive me if anything happened to you. He steps into the turbolift with the Data and Worf.
You have the bridge, Mister Troi! The turbolift doors slide shut. The bridge crew heartily enjoys Riker's momentary demotio house husband.
The shuttlebay doors slide open and the transport vehicle Argo emerges. The Argo is larger than a regular shuttle with a particul large cargo area at the back.

The Argo lands on the planet.  It is primarily a desert environment with some canyons and mountains.  Like Death Valley, blazing heat waves shimmer in the distance.  The shuttle sits silently for a moment.  We wonder at the del then... The rear cargo doors slide open and Picard, Data and Worf roar out on a 24th Century equivalent of a military jeep! Picard drives, Data beside him.  Worf stands in the back mounted phaser canon.  It is a muscular, exciting vehicle Starfleet version of the jeep from old television series Rat Patrol." Picard screeches to a stop.  Data and Worf lurch.  A clou dust momentarily obscures them.  Data quickly monitors th positronic signatures with a tricorder:
The closest signature is two kilometers to the west... that direction, sir.

Thank you, Data. (he smiles) Let's see what she can do. He roars off in a cloud of dust! Picard clearly enjoys driving.  He roars over the desert terrain at breakneck speed, having a hell of a good time. His comrades don't exactly appreciate his free-spirited driving panache. Worf clings on to the mounted phaser canon for dear life. Data steadies himself by grasping onto the rollbar
I will always be baffled by the human predilection for piloting vehicles at unsafe velocities. Picard smiles and drives a little faster.

(monitoring with tricorder) Over that rise, sir... half a kilometer. They continue on.  Before long they can see something on level desert floor before them.  They approach and stop t discover... An android arm.  The fingers patiently drumming the groun
It appears to be... (he scans with his tricorder) ... an arm.
(suspicious) Why is it moving?
Like me, it has been designed with modular power sources.

Mister Worf, if you please. Worf climbs from the jeep and carefully approaches the ar Gingerly picks it up.  The arm responds to being picked u the hand starts feeling around in the air like something a horror movie.  Worf shudders. He returns to the jeep.  Quickly sets the arm down in the rear cargo area.

The next signature is one kilometer to the south. Picard starts the jeep in motion. Time passes as they continue on... coming across another arm... a leg... a torso... another leg... various disassembled components of a Data-like android!

Worf stands uneasily amidst the moving body parts.  There only one component missing: the head.  Picard steers the into a canyon.  Stops.  Data scans with his tricorder, pointing it up into the gently sloping hills that form th sides of the canyon.
The final signature is approximately 300 meters up that incline.
Mister Worf, accompany Data please.
(uneasy) To find the head, sir?
(amused) If you don't mind. Worf and Data climb up into the hills in pursuit of the f piece as Picard opens the jeep's hood and checks the engi
Worf and Data climb as Data scans and indicates the direction:
Ten meters... Worf pulls his phaser, ready.

I think it unlikely you will need your phaser to recover the cranial unit.  Of course, it could bite you. Then they see it. Data's head.  Or the spitting image anyway.  Lying inert the dust before them.
It's you.
The resemblance is... striking. Then the head's eyes suddenly pop open.  It looks up at t with a sort of blank, childlike wonder.
Why am I looking at me?
You are not looking at yourself. You are looking at me.
(looking at Worf) You do not look like me.
No.
(to head) I would like to pick you up now. May I do that?
(to Worf) You have a pretty shirt.
Thank you. Data gently picks up the head.  Looks at it.  The two identical faces gaze at each other.

Fascinating... Then BLAM! -- a boulder near them explodes.  Worf and Dat spin to see... A nomadic tribe of desert ALIENS swarming toward them fir primitive plasma weapons -- Data and Worf race back down the canyon, toward the jeep some open-field running and a bit of phaser action -- Wor firing to distract and slow the aliens, not kill them -- through all of this the head is chattering away blandly:

I have two arms and ten fingers. Do you know where my arms are?  I cannot see where we are going. Where are we going? (Etc... like Threepio in "Empire" when he's strapped to Chewbacca's back.) The action continues.  Then Data finds himself almost surrounded --
Commander! Worf turns -- Data throws the head to Worf like a footbal perfect spiral -- the head is still chattering away -- Wo catches it --

The head abruptly stops talking. Data, hands free now, quickly incapacitates the aliens ar him with a dazzling demonstration of his superior strengt and agility. Meanwhile, Worf tucks the head under his arm and sprints a master running back -- evading aliens and occasionally firing his phaser -- They are closer to the jeep now -- but they are in troubl the swarm of aliens almost overtaking them -- ! When a thundering BLAST sends up a shower of debris, stop the aliens -- Picard is standing in the rear of the jeep, firing the phaser canon. Data and Worf climb into the jeep as Picard leaps into th front seat and roars off --
Worf, standing at the phaser canon, quickly hands the hea Data in the front seat:
If you wouldn't mind.
Thank you. The head looks up at Picard.
You have a shiny head. Picard glances at the head.
He is very observant.
I can see that.
Captain! Picard turns to see that they are being pursued!  The ali are racing after them in crude desert-terrain vehicles --

(to Data) Shall we try some "unsafe velocities?" He floors it -- racing across the desert landscape. Worf fires the mounted phaser canon -- blasting away at t aliens, not killing them, just stopping them -- a few dramatic crashes as the alien vehicles overturn -- Meanwhile:
(to Picard) You have a red shirt.
(to head) This is not an appropriate time for a conversation.
Why?
Because the captain has to concentrate on piloting the vehicle.
Why?
Data!

Sorry, sir. They continue to speed over the landscape -- bouncing and flying over natural rises in the terrain -- trying to eva their pursuers -- Picard puts the pedal to the metal and races through the alien vehicles -- weaving in and out, avoiding their fire Worf blasts away with the phaser cannon -- an exhilaratin adventure -- Finally they are within sight of the Argo -- but they see is surrounded by more of the aliens!

Mister Data.  Let's make like the wind. Data punches some buttons on a dashboard console -- and t Argo LIFTS OFF by remote control -- Data uses the console to swing the Argo around and lower rear cargo doors -- it hovers over the surface -- Picard floors the jeep -- using a natural rise in the ter as a ramp -- the jeep FLIES THROUGH THE AIR -- over the aliens -- and into the cargo bay --

Picard slams on the brakes -- the jeep screeches to a sto the doors shut and the Argo shoots into the air. Picard climbs from the jeep.  He nonchalantly rubs a bit dirt from the hood and then disappears into the main cabi Data and Worf remain in the jeep for a beat, stunned.
(smiles) He must have Klingon blood.
Beverly gazes at the android head.  It gazes back at her.
I think you have nicer eyes. We pull back to reveal she is speaking to Data.  Data sta with Picard, Riker and Geordi.
Our eyes are identical, Doctor. The android is in a framework rig that holds the various parts in place.  The parts are not yet assembled
Geordi?

(at work analyzing the torso section) Well, he seems to have the same internal mechanics as Data but not as much positronic development. The neural pathways aren't nearly as sophisticated.  I'd say he's a prototype.  Something Dr. Soong created before Data.
(to head) Do you have a name, sir?
I am the B-9.
Be-nign.  Dr. Soong's penchant for whimsical names seems to have no end.
(to Riker) You have a fuzzy face.
(trying to ignore the head) Keep me informed, Number One, and, please, put him back together. He goes.  Geordi and Data begin to reassemble the B-9 pie by piece like the Tin Man as:
Can you tell me how you came to be on the planet where we found you?

(blandly) I was taken from my homeworld by people called the "PakJeds." They are fat.  They traded me to a ship belonging to the "Bolians." The "Bolians" are blue.  They put me in a seat and asked me questions. Then they were attacked by another ship... Time passes... And still the B-9 is yammering blandly away.  He is more fully assembled   By this time Beverly is thoroughly bore

Then people called the Delviciansans picked me up.  They have long teeth.  They asked if I do anything to help them.  I told them I could do whatever they wanted.  They asked me to clean out the matrix manifolds.  I told them I did not know what an Matrix manifold looks like.
Excuse me.  I have some diagnostics to run on some medical scanner things. She quickly exits.

And after they showed me the "engine manifolds." Then they showed me something called a "plasma mop" Time passes... And still the B-9 is yammering away.  He is almost comple assembled by now.  Riker is bored out of his mind.
... then the "Cardassians" put me into something called a "garbage chute" and I went out into space again --
Worf to Commander Riker.  I have the tactical manifests ready, sir.
(quickly tapping his comm badge) Worf!  Wonderful!  I'll be right there!... (he stands) Duty calls, gentlemen.  Carry on. He escapes.
Fuzzy face is gone.
Yes, please continue.

I was in space for a long time. Then a ship belonging to the "Talosians" picked me up.  They asked me where I came from.  I told them people called the "Pakleds" took me from my homeworld.  They are fat... Geordi groans. Time passes... And still the B-9 is yammering away.  By this time Geordi slumped in a chair and only Data is listening.  The B-9 i fully assembled.
Then I opened my eyes and saw you. A beat.  The B-9 is finally done with his tale...
Do you know who I am?
You are me.
No.  My name is Data... I am your brother.
Riker and Deanna are having dinner with Worf.
(to Worf) ... and after the ceremony on Betazed, three entire weeks for our honeymoon.
We're going sailing on the Opal Sea.  We've booked an old-fashioned solar catamaran.  Just us and the sun and the waves.
It seems a very... soft honeymoon.
(amused) It's meant to be relaxing.

A Klingon honeymoon begins with the Kholamar desert march where the couple bonds in endurance trials. If they survive the challenge they move on to the Fire Caves of Fek'lhr to face the demons of Gre'thor.
Well, that sounds relaxing too.
It is... invigorating. They see Data enter the lounge, carefully leading the B-9
So they've got him up and running.
He's a very unusual android

(smiles) Runs in the family. They watch as Data leads the B-9 to a table.  Data instru him to sit.  The B-9 sits and stares forward placidly.  D shows him how use a napkin. A note of concern passes over Deanna's face as she watche Data and the B-9.
